content.description: Climb the wavy slab, clip the 1 bolt for protection.  Then climb left to the ledge to belay.
content.location: Right of Rock Angel. Look for the wavy slab.

content.description: An enjoyable route.  Start up a seam/crack to turn the overhang up onto some broken ledges to belay.  Then follow the offwidth section up to the final roof that looks harder than it is.  Jugs on top.
content.location: East of Earth Man.  Rap off slings up top with 2 ropes, an intermediate rap station is 10-15 off line to rap with one rope.

content.description: After climbing 50ft of texas cruise, step right for 10 feet to a short slab that leads to a finger crack.

climbs.name: Super grim raw adrenalin crank pump burn out

content.description: Climb the water streak just right of the last section of texas cruise.
Climb the face using the 1 or 2 bolts to protect. The spinning hangers might scare you off.
content.location: Right of Have Guns.  Scramble off.

content.description: Climb the slab past one bolt (Not entirely sure the bolt referenced here is meant for the dihedral, but it is not Jomby's bolt.) to good gear opportunities higher.  Fairly polished start. The right-leaning off-width 25-30ft off the ground may seem harder than 5.7 if you miss some key beta. The route eases off a lot after the off-width section.
content.location: 100 ft. to the right of Hand Crack and few ft. left of Jomby.  From the top, walk off right to low angle slabs.

content.description: A bouldery start up to clip the worthless bolt.  Long runout on easy terrain up to the 2 bolts that protect the upper moves.
content.location: Past the grunt chamber, this is the first big slab that reaches the ground on Watch Me.  Rap down.

content.description: Climb up the corner into a chimney and jam the roof on the left side.
content.location: Right of Born Again Hard, start above the green moss.  Scramble off.

content.description: Look for the single bolt, 150 feet right of Hand Crack. Seldom climbed since Cowboys went up. can be used as an alternate start for Cowboys and Cossacks.
Climb the overhanging flaring crack on the right side of the Grunt Chamber.
content.location: Obvious crack on the right side of the Grunt Chamber.

content.description: Climb up and clip the bolt that protects the crux.  Pull past the bolt to find 5.9 solo to the top.
content.location: 20 feet past Lady Luck.  Scramble off.

content.description: Nice slab with 3 bolts to the right of Cowboys and Cossacks.
content.protection: Bolts, with some cams needed for the anchor.
content.location: Just right of Cowboys and Cossacks but it starts on a ledge about 25' up - traverse in from the right.

content.description: Climb the crack like the name says.
content.location: 45 feet right of Texas Cruise, look for the hard to miss crack about 10 feet off the deck.

content.description: Climb up and clip the 1 dedicated bolt, then traverse right to finish up on Icabod Crank.
content.location: Start 15 feet left of Icabod Crank.

content.description: Climb into an upside down crescent past the first bolt.  The 2nd bolt guards the crux which can be aided if necessary.
content.location: Right of Fifty Lashes.  Look for the inverted crescent.

content.description:
Slab with 4 bolts on the Watch Me Wall.  Starts as a step off a boulder to a bolt below a small roof.  The route goes left then up - crux at the 1st bolt and 4th bolt. 

  Walk down right.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Some cams are needed to make the belay anchor.

content.description: Climb on slick slopers up the left side of the Grunt Chamber.
content.location: Western most route at Watch Me, left side of the Grunt Chamber.  Scramble down.

content.description: Battle the trees following the diagonal band of red rock up to a thin seam that might take gear.  Climb up to the lip and pull over at the water streak.  50 more feet to a good belay.
content.location: Between Icabod Crank and Earth Man.  Look for the red diagonal band.  Scramble off

content.description: Some great routes here.  Not quite as exposed to the sun at the base, but once up on the wall you will get blazed.
